Abortion is not a ‚ÄúDemocrat issue.‚Äù It affects everyone. In rural counties, people like myself have limited access to essential services. I get my water from a well, and I get my internet from a radio tower ‚Äì but reproductive health care is even more scarce. 1/4

Republicans claim to want personal freedom and limited government, so this should be an important issue to them too. Opponents of abortion rights want to have a say over their own bodies and personal decisions ‚Äì so why take that right away from others? 3/4

In Congress, I‚Äôll fight to make sure everyone has the right to choose what they do with their bodies. An important part of that right is ensuring people have access to the healthcare they need regardless of where they live 4/4

No one should go into debt because they get sick. 

I‚Äôm proud to live in a state taking meaningful steps to ensure folks can receive affordable healthcare.
Uhh, just so we‚Äôre clear, I don‚Äôt support abolishing the Department of Education.
Extremists don‚Äôt pass bills ‚Äì they obstruct progress. There is too much at stake to elect representatives who tout lies or sit on their hands. We need legislators who can get sh!t done.

One of the best parts of this campaign is getting to meet voters across the district. Thank you to everyone in Lewis County who talked to me at the Southwest Washington Fair and at our McFiler‚Äôs meet & greet!
Joe Kent thinks we‚Äôre at war with our own government. I‚Äôm running to help working Washingtonians, not bail out Donald Trump.

(1/2) I am not your average DC Democrat. And I‚Äôm not a swamp creature or some other nonsense that Joe Kent has said. I am a working-class small business owner who can unite this district and bring positive change to Washington.

(2/2) "Stradley, a 79-year-old retired truck driver who considers himself a political independent, said he‚Äôd voted for Herrera Beutler in the primary. But he‚Äôll be backing Gluesenkamp Perez this fall"

This is about real solutions for working Washingtonians ‚Äì not party. #FlipWA03

If you thought Joe Kent would soften his extremist views after the primary, think again. Washingtonians don‚Äôt need a leader who echoes dangerous, fearmongering rhetoric ‚Äì we need a leader who understands the challenges working families face every day.

 knows better than anyone the importance of standing up to the extremist agenda in Washington. I am honored to have the endorsement of such an incredible champion for our democracy!

What a huge step in honoring our country‚Äôs promises to those who served! Finally, veterans impacted by toxin exposure will get the care they need. It‚Äôs clear that when advocates speak up, we can get things done!

Thank you to everyone who has reached out about volunteering for the campaign. No matter who I‚Äôm running against, we‚Äôre going to need your help to win in November! You can sign up on my website: http://marieforcongress.com/volunteer/ or reach out to volunteer@Marieforcongress.com

Federal deadline tonight, shake your piggy banks! Here‚Äôs the link to donate: https://secure.actblue.com/donate/mgp?refcode=website&amount=25 Thank you, thank you, thank you!
Making change starts at the grassroots and I cannot thank the wonderful folks who turned out to doorknock in Longview enough. You all are putting in the work! Together we can #FlipWA03

I am outraged by today‚Äôs Supreme Court decision to reverse Roe v. Wade. 

I, like so many, suffered a miscarriage just two years ago. 
@PPact
 was one of the only places I could turn to get the care I needed, which in this case was an assisted abortion

Without access to safe reproductive care, I could have died or suffered complications that could have prevented me from ever going on to have a successful pregnancy. Without the care Planned Parenthood provided that day, I may not be a mother today.  #WomensRights #RoeVsWade

In congress, I will take on politicians who try to get between a woman and her doctor and fight to protect abortion rights that the Supreme Court put in jeopardy. It‚Äôs more important than ever that mothers like me stand up for our rights.
Thanks to everyone who spoke with me at the Juneteenth Festival and to those of you who came to have a beer with me at Hidden House. I‚Äôm looking forward to more days like these!
Make sure you‚Äôre connected to the campaign through the volunteer page on my website if you want to hear about future opportunities!
As the only pro-choice woman on the ballot I am honored to have the endorsement of the National Women‚Äôs Political Caucus
Making democracy work at the local level takes work and no one knows that more than rural Democrats. So proud to have the endorsement from the hard working Pacific County Dems!
The past two nights have been wonderful! Thank you to the Cowlitz County Democrats and to the 17th LD Democrats for having me.

Such a wonderful Saturday evening at the Cowlitz County Democrats‚Äô Give ‚ÄòEm Hell, Harry dinner. Democrats are ready to flip and keep seats blue! I was thankful for the opportunity to speak about the importance of reproductive freedom as the only pro-choice woman on the ballot

Today we honor those who have lost their lives to preserve our freedoms and protect us all. I am humbled by their sacrifice and grateful for their example. Let us never forget them and work to create a united and just America for all with their legacy in mind üá∫üá∏
New Poll Makes Clear that now with united Democratic field, race in November will be between me and White Nationalist, anti-choice Joe Kent.  We can, and must, win.
100% incumbents aren‚Äôt enough-we‚Äôve got flip! #Blue22

I have officially filed to run for congress in Washington State‚Äôs 3rd Congressional District. I am so thankful for everyone who has supported me so far in this race and can‚Äôt wait to flip this seat blue. Join me!

Also, we will be at the Hazel Dell Parade this weekend and would love for you to walk with us! Please reach out via DM or to madeleine@marieforcongress.com if you‚Äôd like to join!
I am so tired of hearing the #InfantFormula shortage is a woman‚Äôs issue‚Ä¶. Four major companies control 90 percent of the infant formula supply.
Ask any economist, this kind of market consolidation is dangerous for consumers everywhere, it just happens that these ‚Äúconsumers‚Äù are our most vulnerable children.

I‚Äôm honored to receive the endorsement of Rep. Sharon Wylie (49th LD). Sharon has been a leader in the fight for economic, healthcare, and energy reform. I‚Äôm fighting hard to join her in this critical work in Congress for WA-03!

Happy #Mothersday! The truth is, having a child has lit a fire under me like I‚Äôve never experienced. I‚Äôm running for Congress so my son can grow up in an America where the playing field is level, where our rights are respected, and every child has a bright future.

It‚Äôs clear #SCOTUS respects neither precedent nor women‚Äôs basic right to bodily autonomy. It‚Äôs more critical than ever that mothers like me fight for our right to determine our future. We must protect our freedoms & stop politicians from taking rights away. Yours could be next.

I‚Äôm honored to have the endorsement of Hon. Don Bonker, distinguished former Congressman for WA-03. During his time in public service, he was a champion for working families and the environment. I hope to carry on his legacy representing the same district he once did. #FlipWA03

The Flint water crisis began 8 years ago, and the city is still recovering. Officials are finally being held accountable and the city‚Äôs pipes are almost entirely replaced, but the damage done to residents‚Äô trust in their government is irreparable. #CleanWaterForAll

Months after we built our home, the Eagle Creek wildfire jumped the Columbia River a couple miles away. We packed to evacuate and held our breath while firefighters battled the fire. We need a Congress who personally understands the dire climate situation we face. #EarthDay2022

Yesterday, I was excited to join the ribbon-cutting ceremony for the Underwood Conservation District‚Äôs Farm Tool Library! I‚Äôm proud to work with my neighbors to preserve our natural resources and learn sustainable gardening practices. Local community action is so important.

Last year, I paid more in taxes than Jeff Bezos, the second-richest person in the country ‚Äì you read that right. This system doesn‚Äôt work for everyday folks. Stand with me to demand a fair tax code that forces the ultra-wealthy to pay their fair share: https://secure.ngpvan.com/rpEHsxFarEiS39oH9kgHlQ2
